pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [df340a59a4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21546/commits/df340a59a4df3c1d0c9b516bea0e0de38eec75d0)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.MonomialOrder | 1157 | 1158 | +1 (+0.09%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>3 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.Groebner` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.MonomialOrder.DegLex` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.MonomialOrder`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Monic`
`+ Monic.add_of_lt`
`+ Monic.coeff_degree`
`+ Monic.decidable`
`+ Monic.leadingCoeff_eq_one`
`+ Monic.mul`
`+ Monic.ne_zero`
`+ Monic.of_subsingleton`
`+ Monic.pow`
`+ Monic.prod`
`+ coeff_pow_nsmul_degree`
`+ degree_X_add_C`
`+ degree_X_sub_C`
`+ degree_mul_of_mul_leadingCoeff_ne_zero`
`+ degree_one`
`+ degree_pow`
`+ degree_pow_le`
`+ degree_pow_of_pow_leadingCoeff_ne_zero`
`+ degree_subsingleton`
`+ leadingCoeff_X`
`+ leadingCoeff_mul_of_mul_leadingCoeff_ne_zero`
`+ leadingCoeff_neg`
`+ leadingCoeff_one`
`+ leadingCoeff_pow`
`+ leadingCoeff_pow_of_pow_leadingCoeff_ne_zero`
`+ monic_X`
`+ monic_X_add_C`
`+ monic_X_sub_C`
`+ monic_monomial`
`+ monic_monomial_one`
`+ monic_one`
`- degree_mul_of_nonzero_mul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I think we don't really want that lemma?
Oddly enough, I needed it because `rw [leadingCoeff]` or `simp only [leadingCoeff]` had not worked.
entering `rw [MonomialOrder.leadingCoeff]` or `rw [MonomialOrder.Monic]` suffices.

```suggestion
if its leading coefficient (for that monomial order) is 1. -/
```
Same, this is just the equational lemma so you can already do `rw [Monic]`

This lemma and some of the next are mere copies of what is already done for [Polynomial.Monic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Degree/Definitions.html#Polynomial.Monic)

```suggestion
@[nontriviality] theorem Monic.of_subsingleton [Subsingleton R] {f : MvPolynomial σ R} :
```

```suggestion
theorem Monic.leadingCoeff_eq_one {f : MvPolynomial σ R} (hf : m.Monic f) : m.leadingCoeff f = 1 :=
```
Otherwise I would expect something like `p.Monic -> p.leadingCoeff.Monic` (which could actually typecheck if `p : R[X][X]`

The name was chosen following that of [Polynomial.Monic.leadingCoeff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Polynomial/Degree/Definitions.html#Polynomial.Monic.leadingCoeff) !
What's the point of this lemma? It's a non-idiomatic restatement of `Monic.ne_zero`
Idem.

```suggestion
theorem monic_monomial_one {d : σ →₀ ℕ} :
    m.Monic (monomial d (1 : R)) :=
  m.leadingCoeff_monomial 1

@[simp] theorem monic_monomial {d : σ →₀ ℕ} {c : R} :
    m.Monic (monomial d c) ↔ c = 1 :=
```
I made both changes, but why the second one?
`_iff` should be omitted if unambiguous

```suggestion
    m.Monic (monomial d c) ↔ c = 1 := by 
  rw [Monic, m.leadingCoeff_monomial]
```
You already have `Monic.ne_zero`

```suggestion
theorem Monic.pow {f : MvPolynomial σ R} {n : ℕ} (hf : m.Monic f) :
    m.Monic (f ^ n) := by
```
I'm still unsure this lemma is worth having. We don't have `add_subsingleton [AddGroup G] [Subsingleton G] (a b : G) : a + b = a` etc
The point is the `nontriviality` tag. Without that lemma (or some other), the tactic doesn't conclude.
Can you complain on Zulip that you need to write this lemma for `nontriviality` to work?
Yes.

I think this `nontriviality` lemma is reasonable.

> I'm still unsure this lemma is worth having. We don't have `add_subsingleton [AddGroup G] [Subsingleton G] (a b : G) : a + b = a` etc

Because in this case you'd better have this `@[simp, nontriviality]` lemma instead: `eq_zero [Zero G] [Subsingleton G] (a : G) : a = 0`

> Because in this case you'd better have this `@[simp, nontriviality]` lemma instead: `eq_zero [Zero G] [Subsingleton G] (a : G) : a = 0`

This lemma would significantly slow simp down as it has a very general discrimination key
OK, maybe only `@[nontriviality]`
Then one option would be to add `eq_zero` only, and not `degree_subsingleton`

> Then one option would be to add `eq_zero` only, and not `degree_subsingleton`

There is a problem that we have both [Subsingleton.eq_one](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/One/Defs.html#Subsingleton.eq_one) and [Subsingleton.eq_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/One/Defs.html#Subsingleton.eq_zero). Maybe neither of them should be `@[nontriviality]` lemmas, as if it has both one and zero, there will be an infinity loop. So maybe `@[nontriviality] degree_subsingleton` is a reasonable choice.
Same here
Idem. It's useful for `nontriviality`.

```suggestion
theorem coeff_pow_nsmul_degree (f : MvPolynomial σ R) (n : ℕ) :
    (f ^ n).coeff (n • m.degree f) = m.leadingCoeff f ^ n := by
```

```suggestion
    simp only [add_smul, one_smul, pow_add, pow_one]
    rw [m.coeff_mul_of_add_of_degree_le (m.degree_pow_le _) le_rfl, hrec, leadingCoeff]
```

```suggestion
    (hf : m.leadingCoeff f ^ n ≠ 0) :
```

```suggestion
    m.degree (f ^ n) = n • m.degree f := by
```

```suggestion
protected theorem Monic.pow {f : MvPolynomial σ R} {n : ℕ} (hf : m.Monic f) :
```

```suggestion
theorem degree_pow [IsReduced R] (f : MvPolynomial σ R) (n : ℕ) :
    m.degree (f ^ n) = n • m.degree f := by
```

```suggestion
theorem leadingCoeff_pow [IsReduced R] (f : MvPolynomial σ R) (n : ℕ) :
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/MvPolynomial/MonomialOrder/Monic): monic polynomials wrt a monomial order
